comments.body: @kayiwa says we are trying to move away from this approach.
Can we chat about that? I'm curious why
Sure I'll put it on Friday agenda.
@hackartisan Why make this translation now.  We have already written code to deal with them as Aquisition...

@carolyncole I thought this was coming from y'all! Kevin brought this to our checkin today.

The discussion landed on these because they are the phrases currently used in production and seem clearer for users.

Perhaps we should just handle the display language of these two use cases (On Order and In Process - to use their Voyager terms) for users in the request app. When the forms are constructed we already provide special labeling discussing expectations around these two request types that mention these request types. We can discuss tomorrow.
For discussion here is how the form currently looks in the UI in a local env for an On Order (Acquisition) status in Alma.
this is an "Acquisitions and Catalog" Alma status that was formerly known as "In Process."

bibdata.title: On order items are being marked as available

comments.body:
Also the case for "In Process" items https://bibdata-alma-staging.princeton.edu/bibliographic/99122455086806421/holdings/22477860740006421/availability.json

In Voyager "On-Order" = Alma "Acquisition"
In Voyager "In Process" = Alma "Acquisitions and Cataloging"

orangelight.title: Updating requests to the alma branch so we can deploy the latest version to a server
Exclude theses from the electronic portfolio markup

comments.body:
This PR: 

- updates the physical holding location as 
`"holdings_1display": "{\"thesis\":{\"location\":\"Seeley G. Mudd Library (Mudd)\",\"library\":\"Seeley G. Mudd Library (Mudd)\",\"location_code\":\"mudd$stacks\",\"call_number\":\"AC102\",\"call_number_browse\":\"AC102\",\"dspace\":true}}",`

- and keeps the online theses records in the online facet by adding the field `electronic_portfolio_s` which is also used in bibdata to populate online links in the online section. 
`"electronic_portfolio_s": [
"{\"thesis\":{\"call_number\":\"AC102\",\"call_number_browse\":\"AC102\",\"dspace\":true}}"`]
A follow up issue is https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/issues/2486

examples: 
https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/dsp01jq085p03z/raw,
https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/dsp0141687h67f/raw,
https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/dsp0108612n756/raw

pudl-migration.title: repair migration of pudl0036 (Interborough Rapid Transit)

comments.body: Preliminary inspection suggests date_created is the only relevant data field not migrated from PUDL's MODS records. (Not all the MODS records include date_created, by the way.)  Subjects were migrated.  Could we ask the archivists which other fields they believe to be missing?

Esmé replied:

Interborough Rapid Transit missing metadata, e.g.:
http://pudl.princeton.edu/objects/170178dc-4220-4736-b10e-f28b41fa4c6e
Physical Description: 1 poster; approximately 21×16 inches
Origin: New York (N.Y.), 1925
Series: The Subway Sun. Number 15
